website_summaries.verdict: This unique sock aid lets you slide your foot into the sock, with the assistance of a trough piece that rests on the floor.
pros: Unique cradle design expands and holds your sock open for you
Helps with taking socks off and putting shoes on, too
Handle helps act as a shoe horn
cons: Not good for use with compression stockings or for individuals with diminished hand strength

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Only works in one specific direction, and for smaller ankle/quarter socks. Longer Crew socks or compression socks will not work at all. Cheap flimsy plastic does not inspire quality or confidence that it will last. Returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a disabled veteran. He is not able to bend his legs and also has difficulties bending his back. He required my help putting on his socks and pants! I was skeptical when ordering your Sock Slider, but I can honestly say: this Slider is the best thing that has happened to my husband in a very long time! He is able to put on his socks AND pants without my help! Thank you so much for making a Veteran happy!
customer_reviews.author: germangirl

customer_reviews.title: Not for anyone even slightly overweight or swollen legs
customer_reviews.text: If you have any leg swelling, this won't work. Bought it for my dad with congestive heart failure and diabetes. His leg is swollen, so his leg doesn't fit in it, which means it doesn't work for him
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to use. My father didn't have the strength to put his compression socks on it. His foot was too wide to use it. Waste of our money unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ThankYou
customer_reviews.text: I have severe back problems and it is almost impossible for me to get socks on by myself. I bought the Sock Slider and I have no problems at all. This product is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great for people with problems reaching their feet
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I had one of my hips replaced and it is pretty hard for me to reach my foot. This thing helps a ton. Definitely recommend for anyone with difficulty reaching their feet.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: It may work OK using regular socks; however, with compression socks it's a royal pain. Compression socks causes the opening to much smaller, thereby making it very difficult to slide your foot into the sock. It was so difficult that the interlocking pieces came apart.
customer_reviews.author: MikeWhiz

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me after back surgery
customer_reviews.text: I had multiple back surgeries and still cannot put on my own socks nor sit/reach/bend/twist, so one of my students recommended this to me. The rod used to hold it in place is too short for me to use without bending or reaching, and I could not get it to work consistently. Among my attempts, I only got the sock even partially on once. The plastic is better quality than some reviews indicated, but it simply didn’t help me. (I am 6’0” tall if that helps.) There’s a chance it could be more effective for differently-sized people or different socks, but it simply did not help me in my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Compression Stockings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help me put on my compression stockings. The advertising said it could be used for this. But it really doesn't work at all for it. They may work well for regular socks, but not compression stockings. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Randy Maller

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, does what you want it to!
customer_reviews.text: I wondered if this would work, and would be sturdy enough... my husband has problems with getting his socks on and has large feet (size 11 double wide). It took a bit of effort to get is diabetic socks on but once he got the technique down, he said he really like it and make it much easier. ..and yes it was sturdy enough!
customer_reviews.author: waterlilys

customer_reviews.title: Helps - but not foolproof
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to assist in getting my sock on, after a hip replacement. Results are somewhat inconsistent. Sometimes the sock will slide completely on the foot during the first attempt, other times it goes only halfway and I have to start over. For crew length sweat socks or dress socks you have to double-fold the sock onto the device. This can be difficult depending on how strong the elastic is. The instructions are a bit confusing in this regard. Also, I cannot imagine this gadget would work well for compression hose, knowing how much straining is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Father found too hard to use
customer_reviews.text: My father found this way too difficult to use. He does not use compression sock but smart wool hiking socks and they were very difficult to put on the device. After many different attempts we got it to work but the stock pole he could not use at all. He decided in the end it was not worth it. He found a fast method using a step stool some how.
customer_reviews.author: dlp1nma

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvent
customer_reviews.text: This product would be much more helpful if the throat of the tube were adjustable. This assumes that people who have mobility issues don't have flexibility issues, too. Pointing the toe at that angle for any length of time can be a problem. And especially since I needed to be on a fairly high chair to even attempt that angle, the handle was too short, useless. I manipulated the cuff part with my 32" grabber. But that still didn't fix the angle issue.
customer_reviews.author: hstrybuff

customer_reviews.title: I Really Works
customer_reviews.text: This device really works. I found it easy to use from the included instructions, though I did see a video test of this device which helped as well. I find it works well with all socks though with knee length socks it is harder to load and it does not pull the socks up all the way. The instruction show how to use the handle to pull up knee length socks, but it does not work very well. All in all it works better then I expected. Now, if only there were a device to remove the socks as easily.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Guzowsky

customer_reviews.title: Not for compression socks
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended for compression socks. It may work with regular socks but not compression and I use 20 - 30Hg, the lightest. It needs to fold in on itself and be flexible to accommodate a compression sock. I suggest the Norco Easy Pull sock aid, also carried by Amazon. Removal of any compression sock is going to take force and a metal shoe horn. I'm not even going to waste my time trying to send it back. It's going in my recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: When I first used it it was hard but after a while got the hang of it work but sad to say after a few months the handle thats use for removal of sock stated to bend an now getting worse so not a good deal as I thought the part that puts on ur sock on still works but I really need the handle to remove them very sad an nothing i can do 30days already past so back to the drawing board
customer_reviews.author: kevin beverly

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to help me put on my knee-length ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me put on my knee-length compression socks. However, the socks were too long for the device and even if they had worked, it took me 3-4 time longer to install the sock on the device as opposed to just putting the socks on directly. Probably works okay for shorter socks
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Bill

customer_reviews.title: Horrible solution for my 88 year old mother
customer_reviews.text: This product was a disaster for my elderly mother who was looking for something to help her put her compression stockings on and off. It was clutsy, and the stick actually caused her pain as she tried to use it. I tried to help her with it, and I couldn't make it work any better for her. I'd give this zero stars if I could. We wasted our hard-earned money on a sub-standard product.
customer_reviews.author: Debra T

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works well and is a great value for the price. Make sure you pull the sock onto the slider as much as possible so that the inside of the sock’s toe is right at the top of the slider. The first time, I didn’t do that enough, and my toes ended up several inches from the toe of the sock. After the sock comes around your heel, bend your foot upward and continue to push your foot forward until your sock comes off the slider.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K Sea

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: This sock installer works great, made of plastic but thick enough I doubt I will ever break it. I wear long (over the calf tube socks) and I roll the sock down about 1/2 way and place it on the device (I put the device between my knees when feeding the sock onto the device to make it easier) and then place it on the floor and slide your foot in. It always gets the socks on most of the way onto my feet. I've never used the included T handle.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: AAAAWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Easy on is AMAZING!!! I am a type 2 Diabetic and have limited mobility in my right leg. I need to use compression over the calf socks. Because of the trouble bending my right leg, it has been a daily struggle trying to put on my compression socks! Most days I would just give up or not even try! The result........severely swollen calves and ankles! I can't hardly believe how easy it TRULY is with EASY ON!!!! Thank you so much for changing my life!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Diane Blake

customer_reviews.title: Putting on socks is no longer the hardest part of the day.
customer_reviews.text: My partner insisted he didn't need this; that he wasn't that old. But I bought it anyway and he's used it every morning since. When his back or knee was bugging him, he'd have so much pain getting his socks on that he was exhausted before he got to work. Now he gets to play with a gadget, which appeals to his engineer heart, and getting dressed is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Great product and parents are happy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly parents and they really like it! Both of them have a hard time putting their socks on. I chose this one because it also comes with a shoe horn and they really like that part too! So worth the money...
customer_reviews.author: K.M.

customer_reviews.title: A product that actually works as stated
customer_reviews.text: Initially, found the instructions somewhat confusing, but, after figuring it out and getting the hang of it, using it becomes quite easy. I was amazed at how easily my foot slid into the sock, and happily, that it also worked with putting on my shoe. The product is made of sturdy plastic and assembles easily enough. I ordered this product "new", and it arrived in great shape, in its original packaging, with instructions, and shipped in a sturdy corrugated box. I certainly recommend to anyone who has negative flexibility issues when attempting to put on socks and / or shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works somewhat good??
customer_reviews.text: I have used the plain kind of sock assistance device that has the strings and I thought this would be better for putting on compression socks. But putting it one the floor and trying to get my foot in the position to put the sock on I can't do. I have pick it up with my foot somewhat in it and pushed it against a table leg in order to complete putting on the sock. I can't get it to pull the sock up. But that may be my fault. Even using that handle thing to get the socks off don't work to well. It's all OK I will use it anyway and stop complaining!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Ann M Engebrecht

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: The sock part works just fine even though it has a cheap feel. The shoe horn is a waste of time. Does not work well at all as a shoe horn. At least the sock part you use to put socks on works fine. I guess that is what it is mainly for.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Afraid they might overstretch the socks after a while
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom because she has trouble putting on her socks. This would be the perfect product if it didn’t overly stretch the socks. She refuses to use it anymore out of fear that all her socks would end up sliding off from inside her shoes. Wish there was a way to adjust the width of the half-cylinder where your foot slides into.
customer_reviews.author: EGM

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my father when he needed back surgery. He couldn't bend down far enough to put on his socks without excruciating pain. He lives alone and sometimes would just have cold feet all day because he wasn't able to do it on his own. I live 500 miles away so I thought ordering this might help. I thought it seemed gimmicky but gave it a shot. Im glad I did. He was so thankful for this product and was finally able to put on his socks and take them off without pain!
customer_reviews.author: ChannonF

customer_reviews.title: Great concept,  but not perfect for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandpa in assisted living. He was having trouble bending over to put socks on, and we thought this would be helpful. I think it could have been great, except that the opening where you stretch the sock over is quite large, so he struggled with being able to stretch the sock enough and maneuver it over the opening, so he got frustrated. Probably works great for some, but it didn't work out for him.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: One of the best products out there
customer_reviews.text: I had my hip replaced a couple years ago. I have a hard time doing simple things like putting my socks on. My wife got this for me and I was embarrassed to use it. It sat on my dresser for a couple months. One morning I could barely sit up. So I had no choice. It was super easy to use and painless. I haven't stopped using it since . My wife offers to help me with my socks some days but I rather use this.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great for teenage daughter with arthrogryposis
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter who has arthrogryposis which limits her ability to bend her knees and ankles and also causes her to be weaker. She is 16 and has never been able to put her own socks on until receiving this product. She was immediately able to put her sock onto the sockslider and put the sock on her foot from both a seated and standing position. This has been a boost to her self esteem having the independence.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my elderly mother hoping it would help her put her compression socks on. Unfortunately it is such a cheap piece of product that it doesn't even withstand the pressure of putting compression socks around it. the fact that they refunded the money and didn't even want the product back tells you everything you need to know about it.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Thornback

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for knee-high compression socks
customer_reviews.text: Good for putting on regular cotton socks, but there is no way these can be used for knee- high compression socks. I tried helping my elderly mom and thre is just no way these can do it. The blue shoe horn stick that comes with the contraption is somewhat useful for taking the compression stockings off. If you are looking for something to get compression socks on.... get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Bayarea Girl

customer_reviews.title: This OK
customer_reviews.text: Nice gadget but found the parts were very difficult to slide in, especially the foot part. No way can I slide it together all the way so is not level on the floor which makes it extremely difficult to slide the sock on and then your foot into it. It's impossible to even pull it apart now so that I could put some lubricant on it to make it slide on better. This is definitely something that could be improved on.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. It is made of two parts, that when you slide together, it stays strong especially for winter socks. I used a little contact cement too to make sure. I buy that from Amazon too. I bought two other socksliders from other sources. One seemed to be a fake, and fell apart the first time. The second one had too many parts, and it broke.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Works but not as well as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: This device helps to put your socks on without bending over. It has yet to work perfectly. However it still make putting your socks on easier. Looked at owners manual it showed me that I had put the Sock Installer in backwards "when in doubt, read the instructions" LoL. Now that I have installed the sock holder correctly, I still have trouble getting the sock installer to put the socks on completely, so I have to pull the socks from the foot and finish putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Ball

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend after their hernia operation. Bending to put in socks was hard and painful for her. After receiving this she told me it was so easy to put her socks on and take them off. It take little effort to use. I’m glad I got this for her.
customer_reviews.author: DHC

customer_reviews.title: does not work with compression stockings
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my husband to help put on his compression socks.........can't get the compression socks around!!!!! gave to an elderly neighbor to put on her regular socks.......
customer_reviews.author: diamond

customer_reviews.title: HANDICAP Persons  ANGEL
customer_reviews.text: I have severe back injury, and can not reach feet. This allows ME to put my socks on with NO help from anyone, and is a GREAT product.
customer_reviews.author: michael hallman

customer_reviews.title: Works:  to a degree
customer_reviews.text: Works well for ordinary socks. Moderate compression stockings are problematic; medical full-compression stockings are very difficult. If one notices in the video, a slightly different technique is used for compression stockings: pulling back with the handle. Unit was easy to assemble, but handle kept coming apart and I eventually glued it. One of the problems is its extremely light weight: if you do not put a lot of downward pressure when using, it has a tendency to slip even with the 'non-slip' pads. After using multiple times I found it to be easier and more efficient. But, all-in-all, I rate it just 'ok'
customer_reviews.author: Sheriff

customer_reviews.title: Very bad will not let foot go completely into sock before ...
customer_reviews.text: Very bad will not let foot go completely into sock before coming off. I have tried all type of socks. Very very unsatisfied. Will not reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: nightrider

customer_reviews.title: It's an Amazing Contraption
customer_reviews.text: My elderly husband had been a builder therefore has a very bad back, he also has a angina and finds it hard to breath whilst bending. He had trouble putting his sox on until I bought him this amazing Sock Slider, he loves it and shows everyone how easy it is to use. After seeing the change in him I highly recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a bad hip that doesn’t allow him to bend his leg. He’s always struggled with his socks. I got him this and he gets his socks on and off with ease. My autistic son even enjoys using it because it makes it easier for him to get his socks right.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Works On Light Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: I was having a terrible time putting on the lowest-level 8-15mmHg compression socks, so I took a chance on the Sock Slider. It was a bit of a struggle getting them onto the gadget, but still a better option than without it. However, as per the description, I'm sure any size over the 8-15 socks could not be stretched over the Sock Slider. I'm glad I got this kind with the extra part to help get the socks off as well.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryAuthor

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Will be having hip surgery which I am preparing. Bought this sock aid now to practice before the surgery. It was easy to figure it out. Video was very helpful. I have small feet so my size 5 socks worked very well. Love that slider handle keeps the sock still on the handle when removing socks and that it grabs the cradle by the hook. Yes, no more bending down. I found it was better not to slip the sock all the way down the cradle. I crunch it near the top and the sock slips on better this way.
customer_reviews.author: Esperanza Alcarese

customer_reviews.title: hard to use if your joint mobility is compromised
customer_reviews.text: I have had difficulty using it with regular socks and Tube-X compression sleeves. Have no tried compression socks yet, but it does not take into consider people who have no mobility in their hips like myself.It will take time, obviously, to figure out a way to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: It is workable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He wears a size 14 shoe. He was able to use the sock slider while I was out of town to put on his socks and shoes. It would be easier to use by a small to medium size shoe wearer.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah D.

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this a looooong time ago!
customer_reviews.text: Due to multiple surgeries, putting my socks on has been a struggle. This little device is a Godsend !! Over the calf dress socks are difficult to stretch over the "shoot", but that effort beats the heck out of trying to put on socks without the Sock Slider. I highly recommend this product! Dave
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worth It's Weight in Gold
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble and use. I bought it to use after back/sciatica surgery and am so glad I did. Much better than the other type you put a sock on and throw it on the floor. The pole that comes with it also removes sock easily too. Well worth the price. It saved so much strain on my back and I felt more independent. I leave feedback for very few items, just the ones that are exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne vasile

customer_reviews.title: Long tool useless, poorly built.
customer_reviews.text: The long plastic piece came in 2 pieces to be assembled. Upon trying to connect the 2 pieces it instantly broke/snapped. I never did get it to put together. If you want thsy feature, this product isn't recommended. The base works well. Although sometimes my sock doesn't go on my foot all the way before it comes off the base so I have to start all over again. The base is wide and likely won't work well for non stretchy dress or compression socks. I use it for white cotton ankle socks. There is a hole in the base making it easy to pick up with a grab stick.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Ralston

customer_reviews.title: I hated to have to ask my wife to help me ...
customer_reviews.text: I am in the process of having both of my hips replaced and this product has been a God Send in helping me put on my socks. I hated to have to ask my wife to help me to put on my socks and with this product I don't need any help and can do it myself. Before buying this product I asked my foot doctor about the product to get his feedback and I was told that a lot of his patients use the product so that helped me to decide to give it a try. I am glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Herridge Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband. Not particularly difficult to put together but device stretches the sock so much it seems it would only work with really wide large socks. Was hard for him to slide his foot into the sock. Ended up giving it away to someone else who wanted to try.
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: I actually believe my wife likes it better than me
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a sock helper that had straps. Putting it on was a hassel. Purchased the sock slider and in no time I had it conqured and putting socks on without the aid of my wife. I actually believe my wife likes it better than me. Great product and very sturdy. For someone who can not bend to reach your sock's, this is a must have product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need help getting your socks on? This is for you.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sounds stupid, but it works like a charm. Very sturdy material, easy instructions, and easy to use. I love it! I have very bad knees and can’t bend over very far so this little gadget works great. It is wide enough to get a sock on the biggest foot. I recommend it highly. I even use it for putting on my knee high hose.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma K

customer_reviews.title: Very practical & useful!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my uncle. He is older and was having a hard time bending forward to put on his socks. He LOVES this product!!! He always thanks me for getting this for him. A stick of some sort is included in the package, I think for assisting with removal of the sock. He was not fond of that piece. He just removes the sock himself...that part is easier.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth T.

customer_reviews.title: better than sliced bread- it is like receiving the host at church
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I have bee struggling to put on my right sock for so long and then I inquired about this product I heard a while ago. OMG Sock now goes on in a breeze-I was stunned. I can not thank you enough. I said to my wife, what a blessing- I can not believe this. I owe the maker of this product a lot more than what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Old age is NOT my friend. Bending to put on socks is now nearly impossible. But this handy installer eliminates all the labor. I use it every day for everything from dress socks to thick boot socks. Without this tool I guess I would just go barefoot 😁
customer_reviews.author: SpyderRyder

customer_reviews.title: Weak and more trouble to use
customer_reviews.text: the wand is weak and flimsy. By the time i'm done using it, I'm out of breath. It's really difficult to use, and I'm just gonna give mine away.
customer_reviews.author: Orchid

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: If only it worked as well as the videos show. I was able to get my knee high compression hose on a little easier than just folding them down and doing it by hand, but it isn't nearly as easy as shown. No matter how hard I tried, I could not get the full foot of the hose up to where I put my toe in. I managed to get them on, but it is not as slick as portrayed
customer_reviews.author: Gwen B

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!!! The only sock putter inner that does!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first, and only sock putting on device that has ever actually worked. I can actually get my socks both on and off with my limited movement and tremors. If you've got the Parkinson's scourge this will help you.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought that for Xmas for my husband because he has problem with putting his socks on . It ays that it is also good for compression socks so I was very exacted. We both tried and couln't even put the compression socks on the product. It was too late for me to return it and I really regret buying this product. It is now seating in the box and accumulating dust. So so sad espacially when you are in a limited income (retired).
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: It works so well he wanted another one.
customer_reviews.text: What was unfortunate is that this was a gift for my husband and was delivered it it's box without additional wrappings and since he found tha package on the porch it was no longer a surprise for him. I will have to pay closer attention to that detail in the future. He has had one previously and it works really well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Laudati

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Due to mobility issues and diabetic nerve damage it is very difficult for me to put on socks. I was hesitant to buy one of these but now that I've used it I am so glad I did!!!! I have a wide foot and was worried that that this would be too narrow but it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Robin James

customer_reviews.title: Works better than suggested in the video
customer_reviews.text: Works better than suggested in the video. Due to hip joint problem getting a sock on my right foot was a very painful experience. now it is easy on. easy off. I wish all my online purchases were as satisfying as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Some dexterity is required to use the product which my ...
customer_reviews.text: Some dexterity is required to use the product which my wife was not able to do so we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: So helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have severe arthritis with a great deal of pain when bending and I don't know how I lived without this
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Stop Struggling To Put Socks On!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever...I used to struggle putting on my right sock after I broke a few ribs on that side. I’m young and it was so frustrating every morning...not anymore! Load the sock on, slip foot in sock and I’m off to work. I can’t imagine how this helps elderly be more independent.
customer_reviews.author: Denise A.

customer_reviews.title: I use it quite often.
customer_reviews.text: I have an arthritic hip that prevents me from lifting my leg to put on a sock. This helps me to insert my foot into the sock quite easily. It does take some practice though. I have not figured out how to use the extended shoehorn though.
customer_reviews.author: Harold N.

customer_reviews.title: Muscles needed
customer_reviews.text: My wife wears mild compression socks and neither of us has the strength in our hands to stretch the socks over the device as directed. The slide on section of the device is far too wide. It probably will work with cotton of plain wool socks. Amazon was kind enough to credit us for the device.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has pretty bad arthritis, and putting on his socks had become a very painful task. This is a wonderful device. It is made of plastic, but very sturdy plastic. I am so glad we purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: Makes it easy to put socks on
customer_reviews.text: My older son has a hip condition and diabetes with the related issues. He would not be able to put his own socks on without this device. The last one lasted a few years. Good investment if you have the need.
customer_reviews.author: Gdshort

customer_reviews.title: A must have for leg problems!
customer_reviews.text: Great product to have. Light weight and easy to use. Perfect size for home or travel. My husband is a diabetic and uses it every day and I love it because I don’t have to put his socks on every day and take them off every night. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: handy
customer_reviews.text: A handy product to put on regular socks but I wanted it for compression socks & it just did not make that cut. I Just could not get the sock onto that sleeve But it does a wonderful job on regular socks.
customer_reviews.author: SueS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I don't do a lot of reviews, but in this case I felt like I needed to. I love this thing, I have arthritis in my left knee and sometime putting a sock on is very painful, with this item it is now a breeze!! It is very well made of heavy duty plastic. I hope this helps other seniors.
customer_reviews.author: harborthb

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I needed total hip replacement surgery and needed help getting my socks & shoes on, before & after surgery. I'm so grateful I bought this when I did. It gave me some personal freedom by allowing me to be able to do something for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: I RECOMEND USE.
customer_reviews.text: I USE MILD COMPRESSION SOCKS THAT ARE A LITTLE STRUGGLE TO GET ON THE SLIDER. ONCE ON I CAN SLIP MY FOOT IN EASILY. MUCH BETTER THAN THE STRUGGLE OF GOING DIRECTLY WITH THE SOCK TO THE FOOT.
customer_reviews.author: Polishnurse

customer_reviews.title: Generally OK but not so good with compression socks.
customer_reviews.text: I have COPD and cannot bend over to put on socks. Works fine with regular socks of moderate or loose weave. All sorts of problems when used with tight compression socks, the socks don't grip on to the foot funnel slide and slip off too easily when foot pressure is applied to apply the compression sock.
customer_reviews.author: Orkiwi

customer_reviews.title: this thing is a life saver
customer_reviews.text: A year or so after bladder removal and my wife having to put my socks on i got one of these. It took me a bit but it wasn't long and i got the hang of it. its amazing how it looked like it was going to stretched the snot out of my socks but it didn't and once i learned to position my foot and leg in the right way it worked awesome! a godsend! Bought a spare.
customer_reviews.author: robert g johnson sr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: Even though I explained that I was totally responsible for breaking the sock slider which I purchased. As a courtesy the company sent me a replacement. In regards to the sock slider it works wonderful for a guy like me with some minor mobility issues. I even purchased a second one for my home away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, now I can do my socks 🧦 alone.
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use, after a few times you figure out what works best for you, depending on your situation, like for me my ancle’s are shot and I don’t have much mobility . This product works for me 😊
customer_reviews.author: Suzer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my elderly dad after surgery. With a little practice he was able to get his socks and shoes on in no time. Hospital staff even recommended it for us
customer_reviews.author: Captain

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My aunt is getting older and having a hard time with her socks and shoes. She LOVES this device, it is hard giving up your independence and with inventions like this she doesn't have to as much!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Davis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for Grandma
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the product. Got it for my grandma and she can't even get the sock onto the device. Easy to assemble. Durability hasn't been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: This item is a waste of money and a cheap piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Unable to assemble..pieces don’t fit. Unable to use takes two people. Save your money. I threw mine in the trash..couldn’t even be bothered to return it. Caveat emptor!
customer_reviews.author: Melusina

customer_reviews.title: Dad
customer_reviews.text: Dad asked me to find a "sock putter oner!" That's what I typed in the search bar and this came up. It has been a huge help to him. He can put his own socks on again!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I can actually get a sock on my right foot now. For now I don't use the handle/shoehorn part, so can't really comment on that, but the cradle part seems to be very sturdy. I had a little bit of trouble getting it together, so I don't think I'll be taking it apart again.
customer_reviews.author: Evol Jenius

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, or poor design
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality as the shell tries to come out of the groove it’s suppose to lock into, basically when you put the sleeve on the base by sliding it in the groove, it’s supposed to lock in and stop, but after a few uses, it now Wants to slide out of the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Eagar

customer_reviews.title: A huge help
customer_reviews.text: I have RA in my hips and knees that makes it painful to put socks on. This helps a lot ! Haven't had any problems at all. The sock slider is easy to put together and use...so glad I found it !
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Nyktas

customer_reviews.title: Great help
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a back problem that makes him struggle with his socks. He has used the sock slider several times and is very impressed. I ordered it for him as soon as I saw it advertised on TV. I Ordered it through Amazon. I don't order off TV unless I can use PayPal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: I could not get on my socks without this device. Takes a while to master it. Works better with crew socks then dress socks, But still, I depend on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very heavy and without this product, he would not be able to get socks on. It works as described. He loves it and so do I as now I don't have to help him put his socks on.
customer_reviews.author: Dee S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Available
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my mom she needs help putting on her compression socks this helped her a lot she said it works great
customer_reviews.author: Alwin Schuler aka Loraine

customer_reviews.title: Best one I know of, good workmanship.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, might be room for some evaluation and revisions. The plastic they used is top quality and has smooth finish. Strong stuff too. With a short learning curve the tool works good. It’s the “Best” one I know of for sale....
customer_reviews.author: Ed S

customer_reviews.title: Very good item for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as described very easy to use I like it because I can't bend down to put on my socks this item helps a lot I don't use all my breathing because I have COPD and it's very hard to bend down to put on my socks very good items I recommend it to anyone they have hard time putting on their socks very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: roberto

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to put socks on for anyone who can't bend over easily. I recommend it if you want a easy way to get your socks on.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Marilou Coins

customer_reviews.title: Definitely give this a try...
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of these months ago for my mom who was always struggling with putting her shoes and socks on. She absolutely loves it! I ended up having to buy her another one so she could keep one at my house and one at hers.
customer_reviews.author: Meek

customer_reviews.title: Seems OK
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and another type of sock aid. This one seemed to have lots of pieces to it and the other one was so straight forward and easy that we went with that one. Returned this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jupa

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: First time I used the "Handle" to remove a sock, it broke in half. Tried to put a sock on it could not get it stretched over the chute. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: It works well for my husbands work socks but does not work for my compression stockings. My husband likes it and helps him not be in as much pain.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Worked exactly as advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as advertised!!! After knee surgery, I was unable to fold leg up to put on sock. However, found I could easily bend over and pull the sock on, so I didn't use this but for 2 or 3 days.. Still a great idea and does work (if you had a bad back, this would be great).
customer_reviews.author: Pacaw 66

product_meta.title: Allstar Innovations - Sock Slider - The Easy on, Easy off Sock Aid Kit & Shoe Horn | Pain Free No Bending, Stretching or Straining System that Packs up for Convenient Travel, As Seen on TV
product_meta.description: The Sock Slider System consists of the sock cradle and a long handle that will help you slide your socks on without bending over, twisting or turning. The handle will also help you take your socks off when you're done wearing them and help you hold your shoes in place while you put them on. This system works with most types of socks, regardless of whether you choose dress socks, casual ones, athletic ones, or even compression socks.
feature_bullets: SOCK SLIDER: The fast & easy way to put on & take off your socks comfortably
EASY TO USE: Place your sock on the cradle, lower the cradle to the floor and slide your foot in
PERFECT FOR: Users with mobility limitations, injuries, and pregnancy
VERSATILE: Works with all kinds of socks (Dress, Casual, Athletic & Compression) & works as shoe horn
COMPACT: Packs up easy for storage & convenient travel. Handle designed to work as a shoe horn

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
